definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Rich widows are the only secondhand goods that sell at first-class prices.
sentences.chinese: 孀，是唯一的可以一流的價錢出售的二手貨。

sentences.english: Most of what I wear is actually secondhands.
sentences.chinese: 我穿的很多東西都是二手貨。

sentences.english: Have you bought any second-hand goods before ?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有購買過二手貨的經歷嗎？

sentences.english: Rich widows are the only second-hand goods that sell at first-class prices.
sentences.chinese: 富孀是唯一以一等品的價格出售的二手貨。

sentences.english: Whether that matters depends on your end-user.
sentences.chinese: 需要新貨還是二手貨，取決於你的終端用戶。

sentences.english: There carpet is sell at 25 off the marked price.
sentences.chinese: 富孀，是唯一的可以一流的價錢出售的二手貨。

sentences.english: Although the car is second-hand, it is still in good condition.
sentences.chinese: 雖然這輛車是二手貨，但車況依然挺好。

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
